page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: TRANSPORT LINKS ARE MAJOR FEATURES OF THIS BLOCK.THERE ARE MAIN ROADS WHICH PASS THROUGH THE AREA AND THESE CONVERGE ON THE TOWN CENTRE TO USE THE TWO BRIDGES WHICH PROVIDE THE ONLY MEANS OF CROSSING THE RIVER WEAVER FOR MANY MILES.THE RIVER WEAVER,ALTHOUGH NOT AS IMPORTANT AS IT WAS IN THE PAST,IS STILL A MAJOR MEANS OF CARGO TRANSPORT FOR THE ICI CHEMICAL PLANTS, AS ARE THE CANALS IN THE AREA. THE MAIN PASSENGER RAILWAY IN THE AREA IS THE MANCHESTER TO CHESTER LINE.THERE ARE TWO STATIONS,ONE AT NORTHWICH AND ONE AT GREENBANK.HOWEVER THE MAJORITY OF RAILWAY LINES ARE USED FOR THE TRANSPORT OF LIMESTONE FROM DERBYSHIRE FOR USE AT ICI. NORTHWICH IS A VERY BUSY CENTRE FOR TRANSPORT NETWORKS AND ALSO HAS AN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT ONLY A FEW MILES AWAY AT MANCHESTER.
